titleStmt.title: G. Calvert et al. to Unknown
CWG9376

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the undersigned acquaintenses & friends of thomas J of Smith have bin acquainted with him ever since he has Bin in nelson county Made Statements that Said Smith is a Peacible Man & and ordely citizen and that we never knew him guilty of any Disordily or illegal conduct

G Calvert
N B Morgan
Samule a Mcmakin
John Bayne
A Guist
W P Sinclair
E M Davis
F J Tennill
J S jones
H Sappington
Isaac Bodine
W H Hobbs
N B Mccaskey
Jos Mcclaskey
Peyton McMaken
W. N. Montgomery
B Y Neal
Elijah Davis
Jordan Calbert
William R Cokindolpher
James R Cokindolpher
G W Hobbs
C Sapington
C F Houchent
E R Hobbs
A McMakin
E Ducan
James Leffer
John Shields
Thomas Weaber
